clinical_study.brief_title: Post-healing Follow-up Study in People With Remission of a Diabetic Foot Ulcer
clinical_study.official_title: Post-healing Follow-up Study in People With Remission of a Diabetic Foot Ulcer

brief_summary.textblock: To evaluate the benefit of multidisciplinary specific follow-up of patients with a healed diabetic foot ulcer at the rate of two annual consultation on wound recurrence.

detailed_description.textblock:
Diabetic foot ulcer is a major world health problem with a very high recurrence rate, 50% at two years.
The main causes of diabetic foot ulcer recurrence are inadequate footwear, lack of podology care and lack of self-care. International recommendations call for regular podological monitoring to prevent recurrence of diabetic foot ulcer.
The "remission foot" consultation assesses recommended items and is offered to any healed patient at the rate of two annual visit.
A retrospective study on multidisciplinary specific follow-up may show a real efficacity on recurrence rate.

secondary_outcome.description: Days of hospitalisation for diabetic foot ulcer

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of visits to the pedicure

arm_group.description: Patients who have honored two consultations per year for two years.
Patients who have not honored two consultations per year for two years.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with a diabetic foot ulcer healed who were followed-up in CHSF. All these patients have a high podological risk.
